programs.name: Truth At Work - Indianapolis Headquarters
programs.description: Truth At Work is a Christian organization founded in 1998 that equips and transforms business leaders through peer advisory groups and biblical curriculum to integrate faith into the marketplace. Provides monthly peer advisory roundtables in a secure, confidential environment.

programs.name: Truth At Work - Columbus Chapter
programs.description: Truth At Work peer advisory group providing Christian business leaders with biblical curriculum and confidential roundtable discussions to address business and life challenges.

programs.name: Truth At Work - Cincinnati Chapter
programs.description: Truth At Work peer advisory group led by Mark Wages, providing Christian business leaders with biblical curriculum and confidential roundtable discussions.

programs.name: Truth At Work - Atlanta Chapter
programs.description: Truth At Work peer advisory group led by John Purcell, focusing on developing and coaching leaders and discipling others by integrating faith into business through biblical principles.

programs.name: Truth At Work - Mesa/Gilbert Established Enterprise
programs.description: Truth At Work peer advisory group providing secure environments for business leaders to discuss challenges, learn and implement biblical economic principles, and deepen faith.

programs.name: Truth At Work - North Scottsdale Established Enterprise
programs.description: Truth At Work peer advisory group providing secure environments for business leaders to discuss challenges, learn and implement biblical economic principles, and deepen faith.

programs.name: Truth At Work - West Phoenix Established Enterprise
programs.description: Truth At Work peer advisory group providing secure environments for business leaders to discuss challenges, learn and implement biblical economic principles, and deepen faith.

programs.name: Truth At Work - Waco Chapter
programs.description: Truth At Work peer advisory group led by Pat Murphy, providing Christian business leaders with biblical curriculum and confidential roundtable discussions.

programs.name: Truth At Work - Dallas Chapter
programs.description: Truth At Work peer advisory group led by KJ Cao, providing Christian business leaders with biblical curriculum and confidential roundtable discussions.

programs.name: Truth At Work - San Diego Chapter
programs.description: Truth At Work peer advisory group led by Dean Wakeham, providing Christian business leaders with biblical curriculum and confidential roundtable discussions.

programs.name: Legatus - Fairfield County Chapter
programs.description: Legatus Catholic business leaders chapter established November 16, 2016, operating within the Diocese of Bridgeport. Monthly meetings feature Mass followed by fellowship and dining, providing spiritual formation and networking for Catholic executives.

programs.name: Legatus - Washington DC Chapter
programs.description: Legatus Catholic business leaders chapter established October 27, 2016, operating within the Archdiocese of Washington. Recognized nationally for excellence in programming, featuring monthly gatherings at prestigious venues.

programs.name: Legatus - Baltimore Chapter
programs.description: Legatus Catholic business leaders chapter established November 9, 2005, in the Archdiocese of Baltimore. Monthly meetings on the second Wednesday include Mass, cocktails, dinner, and presentations at the Maryland Club.

programs.name: Legatus - Boston Chapter
programs.description: Legatus Catholic business leaders chapter established December 3, 2019, within the Archdiocese of Boston. Known for vibrancy and enthusiasm, supporting Catholic executives in integrating faith with business leadership.

programs.name: Legatus - Philadelphia Chapter
programs.description: Legatus Catholic business leaders chapter established September 1, 1988, as the second official Legatus chapter. Monthly meetings at various churches and restaurants throughout Philadelphia, historically hosting notable speakers.

programs.name: Legatus - Denver Chapter
programs.description: Legatus Catholic business leaders chapter officially chartered March 2, 2000, as the 19th chapter. Was the fastest chartering in Legatus history at the time, featuring Rosary prayer and Mass celebration.

programs.name: Legatus - Austin Chapter
programs.description: Legatus Catholic business leaders chapter chartered March 18, 2015. Features monthly small group forums (one men's, one women's) discussing faith, family, and business with guest speakers.

programs.name: Legatus - Dallas Chapter
programs.description: Legatus Catholic business leaders chapter officially chartered February 25, 1999, as the 14th chapter with roots tracing back to 1995. Community of Catholic business leaders guided by Monsignor Donald Zimmerman since 2003.

programs.name: Legatus - Houston Chapter
programs.description: Legatus Catholic business leaders chapter chartered October 18, 1995, as the sixth Legatus chapter. Over 30 member couples meet at top-tier restaurants, country clubs, and members' homes for spiritual and social enrichment.

programs.name: Legatus - Chicago Chapter
programs.description: Legatus Catholic business leaders chapter chartered June 22, 1998, within the Archdiocese of Chicago. Considered one of Legatus' most dynamic and active chapters, featuring monthly meetings with fellowship and apostolic outreach.

programs.name: Legatus - Downtown Chicago Chapter
programs.description: Legatus Catholic business leaders chapter in the heart of Chicago, operating within the Archdiocese of Chicago with the blessing of Cardinal Blase J. Cupich. Monthly gatherings include prayer, Mass, and speakers.

programs.name: Legatus - Indianapolis Chapter
programs.description: Legatus Catholic business leaders chapter chartered December 8, 1989, as one of the original chapters. Monthly meetings at Meridian Hills Country Club include special events, Lenten retreats, and social fellowship.

programs.name: Legatus - Detroit Chapter
programs.description: Legatus Catholic business leaders chapter chartered April 28, 1988, within the Archdiocese of Detroit. Served as the original working model for Legatus organizational structures nationwide, winning multiple Angott Awards for membership growth.

programs.name: Legatus - Cincinnati Chapter
programs.description: Legatus Catholic business leaders chapter chartered December 4, 1996, within the Archdiocese of Cincinnati. Received the Legatus Award for Excellence in Programming (1999) and multiple national leadership awards.

programs.name: Legatus - Fort Lauderdale Chapter
programs.description: Legatus Catholic business leaders chapter chartered February 19, 2020, within the Archdiocese of Miami. Monthly meetings on third Wednesday include Mass at Cardinal Gibbons High School followed by dinner at Coral Ridge Country Club.

programs.name: Legatus - Miami Chapter
programs.description: Legatus Catholic business leaders chapter re-chartered February 20, 2020, within the Archdiocese of Miami. Monthly meetings on third Tuesday at Club of Knights Hall include rosary, confession, Mass, reception, dinner, and keynote.

programs.name: Legatus - Orlando Chapter
programs.description: Legatus Catholic business leaders chapter chartered May 1997 in the Diocese of Orlando. Features small group men's and women's Forums for relationships, accountability, and mentorship among Catholic executives.

programs.name: Legatus - Phoenix Chapter
programs.description: Legatus Catholic business leaders chapter officially chartered October 6, 2004, as the 44th chapter. Community dedicated to prayer, fellowship, and faithful witness in the marketplace.

programs.name: Legatus - San Diego Chapter
programs.description: Legatus Catholic business leaders chapter chartered October 15, 1999, with 61 members within the Diocese of San Diego. Monthly meetings primarily at La Jolla Country Club with special events at coastal locations and members' homes.

programs.name: C12 Group - San Antonio Headquarters
programs.description: C12 Business Forums headquarters and national office. C12 is the world's largest peer-learning organization for Christian CEOs, business owners, and executives, founded in 1992 by Buck Jacobs in Tampa, Florida. Provides monthly business forums, executive coaching, and biblical business curriculum.

programs.name: C12 Group - Houston Forum
programs.description: C12 Business Forums in Houston with 9 forums across the metro area. Monthly exclusive, confidential peer forums for CEOs and business leaders building businesses with a biblical worldview. Led by experienced C12 Chairs providing executive coaching.

programs.name: C12 Group - Austin Forum
programs.description: C12 Business Forums in Austin, part of Central Texas territory with 28 total forums. Monthly peer-learning forums for Christian CEOs and business leaders focused on faith-based performance and biblical worldview in business leadership.

programs.name: C12 Group - Atlanta Forum
programs.description: C12 Business Forums in Atlanta Metro with 4 forums. Exclusive, confidential peer advisory forums for CEOs and business leaders focusing on biblical worldview and faith-based business leadership with executive coaching.

programs.name: C12 Group - Orange County Forum
programs.description: C12 Business Forums in Orange County with 4 forums. Exclusive, confidential peer advisory groups for CEOs and business leaders using biblical worldview to maximize performance and energize company cultures.

programs.name: C12 Group - Greenville SC Forum
programs.description: C12 Business Forums in Greenville, South Carolina. Monthly peer forums for Christian CEOs and executives with MBA-level curriculum, wise counsel, and one-on-one executive coaching using the 5-Point Alignment Matrix framework.

programs.name: C12 Group - Charleston SC Forum
programs.description: C12 Business Forums in Charleston, South Carolina. Monthly peer advisory councils for Christian CEOs with focus on faith-driven business transformation through proprietary curriculum and executive coaching.

programs.name: C12 Group - Sarasota/Southwest Florida Forum
programs.description: C12 Business Forums serving Southwest Florida including Sarasota, Fort Myers, Naples, and surrounding areas with 14 forums. Monthly peer-to-peer Business Forums and one-on-one counseling using BaaM (Business as a Ministry) framework for Christian CEOs.

programs.name: C12 Group - Tallahassee Forum
programs.description: C12 Christian Leadership Groups serving Tallahassee, Pensacola, and Destin areas in Northwest Florida. Trusted community of Christian business leaders meeting in exclusive, confidential forums for clarity, accountability, and growth.

programs.name: C12 Group - Colorado Forum
programs.description: C12 Christian CEO peer group in Colorado offering business and industry forums, one-on-one coaching, world-class resources, and annual 360-degree business evaluations for Christian business leaders.

programs.name: Convene - National Headquarters
programs.description: Convene is a trusted community of Christian business leaders who meet monthly in peer-advisory teams to accelerate business results and maximize eternal impact. Offers both in-person and online teams structured by role and organization size.

programs.name: Conversate Peer Advisory Groups - Mount Joy PA
programs.description: Conversate is a community of Christian business owners and leaders utilizing member-driven peer advisory groups of 8-12 individuals to align professional purpose with faith. Monthly half-day meetings focus on collaboration, problem-solving, and prayer.

programs.name: FUSION Leaders - Irvine CA
programs.description: FUSION Leaders is a private networking organization for Christian business leaders. Monthly in-person meetings at MGO CPAs in Irvine focus on Kingdom Network, Service Focus, and Business Success through marketplace ministry.

programs.name: FUSION Leaders - Virtual Mastermind
programs.description: FUSION+ Virtual Mastermind is a monthly online peer group for Christian business and ministry leaders. Meets third Tuesday of each month from 12:00-1:00 PM for equipping and networking.

programs.name: CEO Forum - Highland Village TX Headquarters
programs.description: CEO Forum is a Christ-centered membership community for CEOs and senior executives managing $100M+ in revenue. Focuses on spiritual leadership development, strengthening marriages, and increasing leadership influence through peer networks, coaching, and retreats.

programs.name: CEO Forum - Peachtree City GA
programs.description: CEO Forum peer network in Peachtree City for CEOs and executives managing $100M+ revenue. Offers spiritual leadership development, executive coaching, and transformative leadership formation.

programs.name: CEO Forum - Nashville TN
programs.description: CEO Forum peer network in Nashville for senior executives. Provides safe confidential space for spiritual leadership development, marriage strengthening, and Kingdom advancement.

programs.name: CEO Forum - Jupiter FL
programs.description: CEO Forum peer network in Jupiter, Florida for CEOs and executives. Emphasizes ongoing spiritual leadership development and transformative leadership formation.

programs.name: CEO Forum - Parker CO
programs.description: CEO Forum peer network in Parker, Colorado serving senior executives in the Denver metro area. Offers spiritual leadership formation and executive development.

programs.name: Pinnacle Forum - Mesa AZ Headquarters
programs.description: Pinnacle Forum is a confidential, invitation-only fellowship of Christ-centered peer leaders and executives. Weekly one-hour Forums focus on authentic, transparent sharing using the Four E Strategy: Encourage, Equip, Engage, Execute. Includes specialized groups for young professionals and women.

programs.name: FCCI - Phoenix AZ
programs.description: Fellowship of Companies for Christ International (FCCI) chapter in Phoenix. Global movement of Christian business leaders integrating Biblical principles into business through Business Leadership Groups, relational groups, and digital community.

programs.name: ELO Network - Winnipeg MB
programs.description: ELO Network peer advisory group in Winnipeg supporting meaning-driven Christian business and entrepreneurial leaders through peer advisory groups, leadership programs, and annual conferences.

programs.name: CBMC Trusted Advisor Forums - Atlanta GA
programs.description: Christian Business Men's Connection (CBMC) Trusted Advisor Forums in Atlanta. Monthly 4-hour peer advisory groups of 8-12 senior business leaders focused on integrating faith with business principles and whole-life discipleship.

programs.name: CBMC Trusted Advisor Forums - Charlotte NC
programs.description: CBMC Trusted Advisor Forums in Charlotte providing monthly peer advisory groups for Christian business men. Confidential, facilitator-led teams emphasizing iron sharpening iron peer wisdom and biblical accountability.

programs.name: CBMC Trusted Advisor Forums - Dallas-Fort Worth TX
programs.description: CBMC Trusted Advisor Forums in Dallas-Fort Worth area. Monthly peer groups for senior business leaders and owners focused on marketplace discipleship and biblical business principles.

programs.name: CBMC Trusted Advisor Forums - Chicago IL
programs.description: CBMC Trusted Advisor Forums in Chicago. Monthly structured peer advisory meetings of 8-12 non-competing business leaders with trained facilitators emphasizing Christ-centered discipleship.

programs.name: CBMC Trusted Advisor Forums - Grand Rapids MI
programs.description: CBMC Trusted Advisor Forums in Grand Rapids. Peer advisory groups for Christian business leaders providing confidential forum for faith integration in business decisions.

programs.name: CBMC Trusted Advisor Forums - Columbus OH
programs.description: CBMC Trusted Advisor Forums in Columbus. Monthly peer groups providing marketplace discipleship and helping business professionals develop deeper relationship with God.

programs.description: Truth At Work peer advisory group in Pittsburgh led by Dave Hartman and Mike Hatch, providing Christian business leaders with biblical curriculum and confidential roundtable discussions.

programs.name: Truth At Work - Clark NJ Chapter
programs.description: Truth At Work Christian Roundtable Program in New York/New Jersey Metropolitan Area led by Steve Vorrius. Structured curriculum assisting Christian CEOs, Executives and Business Leaders in building successful businesses based on biblical principles.

programs.description: Truth At Work peer advisory group in Sarasota led by Earl Blackwell, providing Christian business leaders with biblical curriculum and confidential roundtable discussions.
